item.title: USDA says demand for sensitive food stamp data from states is on hold
item.description: The federal government told states to turn over names, birthdates, Social Security numbers and other sensitive data about food assistance recipients. Amid a legal challenge, the agency says the request is on hold.

item.title: How a Damascus Firehouse Illustrates Syria's Divisions and Hope for the Future
item.description: After being on opposite sides of Syria's war, former regime firefighters and members of the White Helmets in a Damascus firehouse are learning to trust each other and work side-by-side.

item.title: Trump asks Congress to wipe out funding for public broadcasting
item.description: President Trump is asking lawmakers to claw back the $1.1 billion in federal subsidies for public broadcasting that Congress approved earlier this year. His request also includes cuts to foreign aid.

item.title: Stabilizing 'operations,' the National Weather Service hires again after Trump cuts
item.description: The National Weather Service says it plans to hire more than 100 additional staff members. The move follows complaints and concerns after the Trump administration eliminated more than 500 positions.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein's new trial is almost over. It could be a litmus test for #MeToo
item.description: Weinstein's sex crimes conviction in New York was overturned last year. In a new trial, three accusers have testified that Weinstein assaulted them. Closing arguments are underway.

item.title: Dozens reported killed as Israel acknowledges troops opened fire near Gaza food point
item.description: For the third time in as many days, Palestinians in Gaza have been shot while trying to get food. Israel has acknowledged that its soldiers opened fire on people who were approaching them.
